reviews.text:
This used to be my regular dinner spot when I was working in the West. But I haven't been back for decades since changing jobs. When I discovered the stall still operating here, it felt like meeting an old friend. But is the old friend still the same?

I remembered the food used to be a tad on the salty side, but this time it was less so. Perhaps my palate has changed with age. Anyway, good for health I suppose. Prices are still alright, and portions are definitely filling enough for most people.

So in short, this old friend hasn't changed much. Nothing is permanent though. I don't know how many more years they'll be here, but I'll certainly be making more trips here while I'm able.

My healthy pleasure when I am craving for teochew porridge. Managed by a friendly old couple. Extremely popular during lunch time but queue moves fast. The variety is amazing. From my understanding, they are open for lunch and dinners on all weekdays. $10.50 for 6 dishes including porridge.
Seasoned and friendly people handling stall. Large variety of dishes  that tastes just nice in flavor and taste. Both porridge and rice available. Good price portion ratio.

This was a rare find after our walk at the Jurong Lake. Our favorite was the salted egg chicken which we got 2 servings. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Place was clean and spacious. Price was very reasonable 7 dishes with 2 porridge with drinks was only $25. Highly recommended.
Legacy teochew porridge. Exceptional chai poh omelette.
